ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This is great for someone who loves GIS, and has no or minimal experience with coding. You could pace yourself relatively well. Really enjoyed it.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: This course was difficult for me, as I didn't have a background in programming, but I thoroughly enjoyed the course, and I learned more in this course than any other I took this term. Of course, I like to teach myself things when possible, so the course format was great for me. I'd imagine other people might feel a little lost by the lack of structure. Also, the inclusion of GEE and QGIS was great, as it gives me more marketable skills, and because ArcGIS won't be a complete monopoly forever (I hope).
I like Dana's explanations. I liked working on assignments...not one aspect I liked most...
Hands on practices; Instructor
The instructor's responses to student questions were particularly helpful in learning how to go about programming tools.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I would have liked some feedback at some point. I know I am being compared to myself, but it's hard to know if the instructor(s) think I'm making sufficient improvements.

Dana changes up his expectations sometimes. This can be a little annoying. At one point he said we would have no assignments for the rest of the semester, then changed his mind the next week. I guess at least dont be so definitive if you think it may change...

The course would have been more helpful to me if taught less early in the morning. Also, inclusion of a lab section would have helped, since work outside of class is where the real learning happens in this course.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: There was no lab section, but a lab section certainly would have been useful.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I will use this in my master's research, as well as (probably) in any future job I'll have.
GREAT intro into programming.
GIS programming has a wide variety of applications, and Python has statistical applications as well. I am interested in these as they apply to energy, transportation, and water issues.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I had a pretty good background in vector and raster analysis going into this program, and I knew learning to use Python would expand my skillset greatly.
Wanted to learn python. Wanted to take GIS to the next step.
improving GIS and programming skills
I took this course to gain experience with the programming that underlies mapping tools.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.
Really enjoyed this course, did just what I hoped.
Very much
Yes -- exceeded expectations.
My basic expectations were met. I learned the fundamental skills behind programming in Python. However, my understanding did not advance as far as I hoped, and I still feel like a novice.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: As long as you're an independent learner, this course is a great way to explore your interests in GIS in a more efficient manner.
It will be a heavier course load than many classes. But if you think you are up to it, you can do it. Dana is very understanding, and you can work at your own pace often! No experience necessary.

Don't be afraid if you haven't taken any programming courses before--the course is flexible and accommodating for a range of students. Project focused, so it's helpful to brainstorm some ideas for projects you might want to pursue earlier in the course rather than later! Dana is always great. Take any/all of his courses if you are interested in GIS/mapping/spatial analysis.

If you would like some exposure to programming, and/or have a particular interest in GIS programming, this is a very useful course. Although I had very little programming experience coming in, I believe this course could be useful to programmers of all levels as well.
